description: i really enjoyed the dancing yak for girls night this week.  it was a bit startling for my gf because she has a strong aversion to bright yellow, and the menus here are bright yellow, but she was able to thumb through the yelp pictures and simplified menu on the site, so crisis averted!  we ordered the chicken momos to start, because, of course.  i thought the red spicy sauce they provided on the side was delicious - and the appetizer is a nice size for sharing - key to success. two of us ordered the thali plate ($18 or so) - i got it with spicy goat curry as the 'main.' i thought the thali plate was delicious and a great deal - a lot of food, however, i wish they gave you a rice or naan option. my other gf got the chicken tikka masala with garlic naan, and it was deeelicious. omg i want to use that garlic naan as a blanket. it was just the right amount of chew, seasoning, fluff, everything. we lucked out because the kitchen had an extra order so we had that for free! nom nom! the only item to improve in my opinion are the cocktails  - we tried 2 and both were too light and/or too citrus-y and/or too sour. but the food is delicious and the service was so warm and inviting! would come back.
author: Christina L.

description: Good service, great food! I'll definitely go back. A lot of vegetarian options. We had the Daal Bhat Thali salmon curry, the vegetable momo, some roasted eggplant dish & okra: delicious. Highly recommend the okra & the roasted eggplant, definitely my favorite dishes of the dinner!
author: Meryl H.

description: Great atmosphere, food, and drinks but slow and uncoordinated service particularly on a Friday night.  I had a reservation and still waited 20 min as they had no table open. Food wise, thali and chicken curry  was delicious. They ran out of chicken momos (a signature dish) halfway through the evening. Would go back again to try their momos.
author: Cary L.

description: Awesome new local business in the neighborhood. Some of the best Indian/Nepalese food I've had in SF. My faves are the chicken momos, butter chicken, and garlic naan. Fav cocktail is the Don't Talk Yak. Portions are generous too!
author: Carrie R.

description: Liked the food! We ordered the vegetarian Momo and the vegetarian thali. The thali is okay - not the best when it comes to flavors. The momos were absolutely delicious, and the sauce that it comes with is so good! The cocktails are refreshing too. Definitely coming back to try some curry entrees with naan!
author: Poornima S.

description: This place is good. It's a pretty big restaurant and the food is tasty. The only complaint I have is that they should include naan with the thali meals. There's lots of varieties in the thali meals with a small amount of rice. It would've been better if they included naan with that. The service was good. I recommend this place.
author: Dave S.

description: If you're looking for an alternative to the perpetually hour+ line at Burma Love, you no longer have to look further than across the street to Dancing Yak. I've been recommending this trendy take on Nepalese to everyone who will listen! I first visited about a month ago during their soft opening and since have been back for take-out. Everything I've tried has been outstanding - chicken momo, vegan pakoda, veggie daal bhat thali, aloo cauli, paratha bread - but my favorite thus far has been the okra bhindi tarkari (I've skewed slightly more vegetarian than usual here due to my dinner companions for both visits). Excited to go back and check out the bar and cocktails. It's a really great addition to the neighborhood and I hope they stick around for the long haul.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Awesome food and gracious hosts. My family and I stumbled onto this place and what luck!! I had the Dal Makhni with rice. Yum yum!! The tea was strong and satisfying.  My son had the pork and loved it.   All the while our host kept us taken care of throughout our dinner.

We look forward to our next visit.
:-)
author: Lucy F.

description: The food is delicious but even more so, the service is splendid! In the crazy chaos of Valencia restaurants, the vibe here is so mellow and relaxed.  I love this place!!
author: Deena D.

description: Intimate, cosy space. The pakodey were exceptional. I've had better momos and they took far too long. The owner and staff is really charming and I will go back to try some of the food on the menu.
author: Ashima S.

description: Easy to walk in on a Thursday night for a seat at the bar (full menu). Drinks (few feet to summit) were delicious. Daniel is a master bartender. Food was better than great. We got the chicken daal bhat thali, lamb aloo, and plain naan. Perfect amount of food for two people plus some extra. Will 100% be coming back!
author: Alice M.

description: Pretty good food. The veg and chicken Momo's were really good. They also had buckwheat rotis which you don't see on every menu. Definitely worth trying.
author: Rangoli A.

description:
Great use of spices and seasonings.  We had the paneer  chili  ( great seasoning) and chicken momos to start. The mojo sauce was a bit bland but seemed to have perked up the next day hen we reheated it.  The Curry Burry was soup like with only a bit of cauliflower in it. We saved the sauce for tonight's curry burry with shrimp. The Baigan Ko Tarkari (eggplant) was devine  Garlin Nan great. We also got the minced lamb tandoori plate.   Needless to say, we took some food home. 
We will be going back to try the Dall Bhat Thali and this time save room for dessert.
author: Lois M.

description:
You need to go here.  Now.

We went a couple of days ago and are heading back soon.  
We enjoyed veggie momos  and pakoda for apps.  The momos were better than any we had in Kathmandu.  They were soft but still firm with deliciously shredded veggie innards.  The pakodas had a tamarind sauce as well as a fresh mint sauce.  Both sauces were great, but the mint was sublime, sooo fresh.  (I'm ordering delivery tonight and getting a few orders of momos.)
For dinner we had veggie Daal Bhat Thai and garlic naan.  Soo fresh and yummy.  Each little bowl was better than the last.  Of the three bowls the lentil one was my favorite, but it really was a three way tie.
So the food was great to say the least. 
Our server was fast and friendly and was there when needed, but never hovered.  And the hostess was wonderful, chatting us up about out trips to Nepal and her family.  Just what we needed a little trip to Thamel, but only a block away.

Oh!  and we got a mango/coconut milk ice cream pop with the check.
YES!!!!!!!   
Now, you need to go there, NOW.
author: Chester T.

description: This place is great! The food is fresh and flavorful and the cocktails are super fun :) Definitely recommend the cashew shrimp and the black lentil daal.
author: Rashmi J.

description:
Being a supporter of family business we stopped by Dancing Yak couple a week back. I had MOMO and my wife had Thali. MOMOs were really juicy and decently sized. Sauce (chatani) that goes along was just the perfect blend of spices. My wife was decently surprised by the taste, quality of service and the  ambience. 

Suraksha (owner) is a truly amazing person; made sure that we  were taken care of and food met our expectations. Easy to see that she puts her heart and pride into what she does. Thanks for introducing the new taste in the community. We are definitely going back.
author: Rick R.

description: Great food and great hospitality! Definitely recommend. I loved the naan and curry. The momo's are really good too.
author: Roz M.

description: Wonderful service and the food was spectacular. I had a wonderful time and would come back in a heartbeat.
author: Spencer S.

description: Such good food, very warm people, clearly a family place. Reasonable for SF. We needed some Himalayan food in the Mission and this place delivers!
author: Sam W.

description: Theis is the best place to pleasure you palette. Omg the MoMo is like one of the best in the world. Cheers. If I could I would come here everyday
author: Dhi R.

description: This is a 4.5 Star I'll round up to 5. This is a nice new place with a lot of potential. The portions are generous, the people are friendly, and the food is really good. I liked my drink a lot, too. I think the chicken curry was the best thing we had. The roasted cauliflower was good, too. The momos were fantastic as well. Whoops, I just listed everything we ate!
author: David B.

description: Awesome food!!!! Awesome ambiance!!!! Awesome service..coming back again.Thankyou for such a delicious food
author: Riyaz H.

description: Ordered yet again, tikka masala, momos, and garlic naan were delicious as always. Tried the new Old Fashioned cocktail with bourbon infused with turmeric and peppercorns - AMAZING! Also really loved the special, vegan coconut curry with vegetable dumplings (very kofta-like, but vegan).
author: Greg K.

description:
Ambiance is good. Clean and very spacious! Would be great for groups! The Paneer chilli appetizer is excellent. We had them make it  "Muy Spicy" and it was delicious.  The chicken curry was very good , if you are not into  cashew'y/creamy tikka masala type gravy but yet want the Indian curry , then this is your place.  The tandoori roti was good, but the buckwheat roti was very very oily.  
Couple of suggestion if they see this :D
1- less oily buckwheat roti / pancake ?
2- oh pls oh pls change the name of dessert lal mohan to gulab jamun! :D

Service was good!  Lots of potential. I will be back again to try the thali!
author: Raja K.

description: it's obvious this restaurant just opened. Service is extremely slow but not because they aren't trying. Their staff is friendly and responsive when approached or flagged down. They seem under staffed. The ambiance is nice. Colorful, upbeat vibe, trendy. The food is good. The dessert was especially good - rice pudding and mango. The price is worth the slow service if you aren't in a hurry. I think the restaurant service will improve over time as they figure out training and staffing needs better
author: crystle w.

description: Good food, good ambience and good people, what else we need for happy dine....tried their authentic Nepali dishes it's just perfect. Since I m pork lover I ordered pork chili and pork belly both r yum. Tried chili in couple of restaurants but these guys able to pull the right flavor, touch of sweet, tangy and Smokey which is must. Pork belly is so homely made, perfectly spiced, pieces are lil bigger they could go slightly smaller. Bara is must try which is our Nepali version of gluten free pan cake. they served with gravy which is nice...again I would prefer thick gray so I can dip. Heard lot about their thali And khicadi which is like paella mix of everything in one pot...would definitely go back to try...
author: Sakun R.

description:
- Not loud, spacious -- are we even in SF?

- Delicious food, I recommend the main Nepalese thing, it comes with like 5 different parts

- Cocktails are great and all look amazing. The first one, 'cheers to Nepal' or something along those lines, was delicious lemon-limade with vodka

- Super friendly service!
author: B H.

description: Great paneer chilli and pakodas! The paneer is probably the best I've eaten in the US! The veg momos were okay... The sauce served with them could be better. The ambience is fantastic... very different and interesting!
author: Deepti K.

description: The okra was amazing!!! This is a really delicious new Nepalese restaurant. Very veggie/vegan friendly, and the tea is delicious.
author: Abby R.

description: The food was amazing but I'm kinda sad the tiki masala and curries didn't come with naan or rice but overall it was great!
author: Audrey Z.

description:
We came to this restaurant as part of a large group, and most restaurants HATE large groups! But our server was so attentive, so warm, and so accommodating, that it made a lasting impression! 

The food was terrific, and having not tried Nepalese  food before, we were so pleasantly surprised at how tasty it was! Some of it was reminiscent of Indian cuisine, but lighter. We thoroughly enjoyed the signature chicken and dumplings eggplant dish! The garlic naan came to the table and was so fragrant and delicious!!!

Our server offered us the house made  hot sauce and when she saw that we enjoyed it, even offered to pack some to go with leftovers!

We will definitely be back to try more food and enjoy the great service again!
author: Douglas S.

description: I have been to several South asian restaurants in the city and this is the best so far. Very clean, good food, relaxing atmosphere and unique taste of Nepal food . In the middle of Valencia and 14th street, close to everywhere. All the best to everyone.
author: Prabin S.

description: Living nearby, I have been frustrated at the revolving door of overpriced and bad restaurants occupying this perhaps cursed spot.  I was skeptical when I saw Dancing Yak open, worried it would follow the same bad script as previous restaurants - but I was pleasantly surprised.  I had a lovely meal with kind service, tasty food and a fun atmosphere.  I had the Thali plate which was a great value at $18 (lamb) - it came with an assortment of tasty dishes.  I'm really excited to have this place nearby.
author: Daniel W.

description: This was a phenomenal culinary experience! It was like being wrapped in a deliciously spiced blanket of culture and comforting warmth. Our servers were lovely, and made some great recommendations. To start, we enjoyed the Chicken Momo, the Pork Belly Bhutwa, and the Samosa Tarkari, all super tasty. For the entrees we had the Goat Curry and the Dhading style Chicken Curry with a side of rice. The flavors of each were perfectly balanced and beautifully spiced. After, our server surprised us with a delicately flavored and fragrant iced milk with a pistachio crust, a perfect way to finish our meal at the first Dancing Yak. My only regret is that we live so far away and cannot visit each week. We'll be sure to return to this lovely gem when we come back to San Francisco!
author: Tara C.

description: Great food, great service and superb ambience. Just wow!! Planning to visit more often
author: Manish S.

description: Loved this place!  Delicious, fresh dishes with fantastic flavors.  Great options for vegetarians.  I really enjoyed their ginger turmeric tea and the vegetarian samosas.  Friendly service, vibrant music and fun ambience.
author: Christina T.

description: I wrote a long detailed review the night they opened but it appears to be missing now. So I don't remember specifics, only that I LOVED every dish I had. My new fave place! Loads of vegetarian and vegan dishes and super friendly staff.
author: Janis E.

description: Chicken Momos, pork belly, and all three types of curry we ordered were amazing. Great service and great staff. Completely unique flavors and atmosphere. Will definitely be returning soon.
author: Tim M.

description: I wanted to like this place. It had so many high reviews. The staff were welcoming. Menu and cocktails looked.good. That's about it. It took 30 minutes to get our drinks and longer for food. A free snack of rice crispies and papadum arrived. Then appetizer  of momos was super salty and rubbery. Mains were delivered without spoons with one dish missing. I could see discussion between server and cooks about the missing dish...confusion reigned. The couple next to us sent their food back to the kitchen. The final dish arrived after we were almost finished with the other dishes and full. Slow staff or too few staff, many of them looping around as I watched to make eye contact. Asking for something sent the staff to the kitchen to forget and start serving someone else.  Major work needed or this place will be short lived.
author: Sheila K.

description: Really good food prepared by the owner's mom in the kitchen! Liked the ambient and lounge music as well. I'll come back again for sure
author: Praveen K.

description: My wife, son and I were walking up Valencia Street looking for a place to eat on a Saturday night that wasn't crowded. We settled on a Nepali place after seeing a tiny sign on the sidewalk with a humorous name: Dancing Yak. It wasn't busy, but it looked fine, so we took a chance. So glad we did! We had our fill of delicious food and warm service. The server and manager were helpful and seemed happy to tell us about Nepalese food. We had the Dal Makhni, Pork Curry with Bok Choy and the Goat Curry meal. Everything was absolutely delicious, including the puffed rice snack and the garlic naan. My wife loved the chai. Come to find they had only been open for five days. I hope they keep up the quality of the food and the friendly service. Our experience at Dancing Yak was better than anything we could even have dreamed of when we settled for a not-so-busy place in the Mission a warm Saturday night!
author: Peter F.

description: This was the best meal I've had in a long time! Their dishes are perfectly spiced. i couldn't eat the whole meal so i took leftovers home and it was even better the second day. I am vegan and my friends are not. We were equally impressed with our dishes. I will be back!
author: Erin A.

description: Ordered for takeaway from here, and the meal was really sorry. The amount was paltry for the price. Will never order from here again.
author: Naveen P.

description: Great ambiance and flavors but both the pork belly and goat were over cooked/tough.  Had to send the goat back because I picked 3 slivers of bone out of my couple bites.  They were apologetic and I would try them again but stick with fish/chicken/veggie plates.
author: Phil S.

description: We walked into dancing yak on their soft opening. The decor is absolutely beautiful. The colors of the wall and the artworks hanging on the wall are very welcoming. The lounge area is very cozy and warm. The food is very flavorful and there are lots of vegetarian options as well. The staffs are very friendly and always smiling.  We will be back again.
author: Kalyan T.

description: I got the vegetarian thali and loved it. Complex, wonderful flavors. Will be back soon (possibly today). Love too that they're open for lunch since my office is nearby.
author: Shireen M.

description: Dancing Yak makes me so happy. We just finished dinner there and we had the best time. My girlfriend is Nepali and we'd just returned from Kathmandu when we heard they would be opening so we were so excited. I may have written them a few emails before they opened letting them know. Either way, everyone was super super nice from the second we walked through the door. The dhading is sensational. It's like from another planet.  The bhindi takari was amazing and the khichidi was incredible. I cannot recommend this place enough. I can't wait to go back again and again.
author: John S.

description: We ordered Vegetarian Momos, Veg Tandoor Thali and Nepali Thali with Goat Curry. Veg momos were delicious. I would like to see better curries or little more variety in the Thali for the price.
author: Jaya K.

description: we went on sunday,we were four people.it was wonderful and service was also very good amazing staffs ,food was also great.don't forget to order kuwati it was amazing
author: Neel G.
